derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (originally as a noun denoting a wild Norse warrior who fought with frenzy): from Old Norse berserkr (noun), probably from birn-, bjorn (see bear) + serkr 'coat', but also possibly from berr 'bare' (i.e. without armour)

entry.def: Berserk means crazy and out of control.

example.ex: He tossed back his head in a howl of berserk laughter.

entry.def: If someone or something goes berserk, they lose control of themselves and become very angry or violent.

example.ex: When I saw him I went berserk.

means.word_mean: 1. one of the ancient Norse warriors legendary for working themselves into a frenzy before a battle and fighting with reckless savagery and insane fury
1. in a murderous frenzy as if possessed by a demon;
